column4: I upgraded my laptop and I'm getting " kernel panic - not syncing : VFS: unable to mount root FS on unknown-block" when it boots. Any ideas?
EXACTLY the same error i get on 8.10
which ubuntu version are you running?
i got it upgrading to 8.10
looks like there is a bug in this version (8.10)
here is what I get: [0.700183] VFS: Can not open root-device "<NULL>" or unknown-block (8,1)
is there a fix? i need to get it up and running asap.
[0.700244] Please append correct "root=" option; here are available partitions:
[0.700329 Kernel panic - not syncing: VFS: Unable to mount fs on unknown-block (8,1)
can you read my errors and see if this is what YOU get?
kernel panic - not syncing : VFS: unable to mount root FS on unknown-block (0,0) not 8,1
i've been screwing with this thing for a week without sleep
that's ok. i got that one also, block number does not matter, it comes in several flavors depending on how you are trying to but it
what drive are you using? did you say you are trying to put it on laptop?
do you know the sata controller chipset brand and manufacturer?
yeah. I was told it was because the kernal was never upgraded because it failed to complete the upgrade.
i don't get what you mean about kernel upgrade
who told you this and can you tell me exactly what they told you?
the problem with kernel is that it boots off of liveCD, so there is something really funky with 8.10. it does not look that straightforward
anybody knows if i can upgrade to 9.04 off of 8.10 live CD? cause i can't fry from ISO
do you have a sata drive?
